entry.title: Utilizing medical informatics to improve healthcare access in Armenia

media:group.media:title: Utilizing medical informatics to improve healthcare access in Armenia
media:group.media:description:
Dr. Armine Lulejian is an Assistant Professor of Clinical Public Health at the University of Southern California, and the Program Director for the Avetis Health Informatics Fellowship. Dr. Lulejian and her team have been aiming to create a talent pool of specialists who have expertise in biomedical informatics. Their goal is to digitize and modernize the healthcare system in Armenia. Dr. Lulejian discusses how digital technologies in healthcare improve delivery and outcomes, what the potential risks are and where she would like to see Armenia‚Äôs healthcare system in the future.

entry.title: 700 Projects in Armenia, Artsakh and around the world

media:group.media:title: 700 Projects in Armenia, Artsakh and around the world
media:group.media:description:
For 20 years, Ruben Vardanyan and Noubar Afeyan have supported over 700 initiatives across Armenia, Artsakh and around the world, with the goal of ensuring sustainable development, creating prosperity and preserving cultural heritage. Here is a breakdown of these projects, sector by sector.

entry.title: Armenia continues to improve its democracy score, according to new report

media:group.media:title: Armenia continues to improve its democracy score, according to new report
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenian Prime Minister Nikol Pashinyan and Russian President Vladimir Putin signed seven bilateral documents on Tuesday, cementing Russo-Armenian cooperation in labor, justice, energy, education and other sectors. üìçArmenia is one of only three countries in the broader Eurasia region continuing to improve its democracy score, according to a new report by Washington-based Freedom House.

entry.title: Armenians in Artsakh: Life Under the Shadow of Conflict

media:group.media:title: Armenians in Artsakh: Life Under the Shadow of Conflict
media:group.media:description:
In the latest edition of Frontlines, Karnig Kerkonian and Garo B. Ghazarian talk to Anush Ghavalyan, a former advisor to Artsakh‚Äôs speaker of parliament and presenter at Artsakh‚Äôs Public TV. Anush discusses the daily lives of Armenians in Artsakh who, under the shadow of conflict, are facing unprecedented and uncertain times.
